tossupQ:
GENERAL SCIENCE Short Answer Providing your answer as a decimal to the nearest 
hundredth, what is the density in grams per cubic centimeter of a material with a mass of 2.02 
grams and a volume of 0.500 cubic centimeters?
bonusQ:
GENERAL SCIENCE Short Answer By number, identify all of the following four 
characteristics that are TRUE of hail: 1) most hail is less than 5 inches in diameter; 2) it is 
formed of partially frozen raindrops; 3) it is formed from chunks of ice; 4) it falls from the clouds 
as rain.

tossupQ:
MATH Short Answer In triangle ABC, angle C is a right angle, side AC is equal to 15 units, 
and side BC is equal to 8 units. What is the length, in units, of side AB?
bonusQ:
MATH Short Answer By how much is the sum of the first 10 even positive integers greater 
than the sum of the first 10 positive integers?

tossupQ: PHYSICAL SCIENCE Short Answer How many protons are in an atom of carbon-14?
bonusQ:
PHYSICAL SCIENCE Short Answer Given g as 10 meters per second squared, what is the 
weight, in newtons, of a crate with a mass of 10 kilograms being raised from the floor at a 
steady speed?

tossupQ:
EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE Multiple Choice Which of the following determines the size 
of the image formed by a telescope? 
 
W) The focal length of the main lens or mirror 
X) The thickness of the lens 
Y) The size of the aperture 
Z) The size of the mirror
tossupA: W) THE FOCAL LENGTH OF THE MAIN LENS OR MIRROR
bonusQ:
EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE Short Answer By name or number, identify all of the 
following four moon phases in which a neap tide can occur: 1) first quarter, 2) last quarter, 3) 
new moon, 4) full moon.
bonusA: FIRST QUARTER AND LAST QUARTER (ACCEPT: 1 AND 2)

tossupQ:

trait crosses with a male who also displays this trait phenotypically. What percentage of their 
sons will display this trait?

choices that are unsaturated hydrocarbons: 1) propane, 2) ethene, 3) acetylene, 4) benzene.

tossupQ:
ENERGY Multiple Choice Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of the Tampa Bay 
desalination plant? 
 
W) It can produce up to 25 million gallons of drinking water per day 
X) It uses the process of reverse osmosis to produce drinking water from saltwater 
Y) Concentrated seawater is directed back to the power plant, where it is mixed with cooling 
water and returned to the Bay 
Z) Increased salinity in Tampa Bay is a proven environmental hazard of this operation
tossupA:
Z) INCREASED SALINITY IN TAMPA BAY IS A PROVEN ENVIRONMENTAL 
HAZARD OF THIS OPERATION
bonusQ:
ENERGY Multiple Choice Which of the following processes involves the scattering of a 
photon off of an electron? 
 
W) Compton scattering 
X) Møller scattering 
Y) Pair production 
Z) Bhabha scattering

tossupQ:
MATH Short Answer Given that a plane is at an angle between 1 and 89 degrees to the 
axis of a right circular cylinder, what is the name of the curve formed at their intersection?
bonusQ:
MATH Short Answer To be labeled “sugar free,” a candy must contain less than 0.5 grams 
of sugar per 40 grams. If a serving of sugar free candy is 25 grams, what is the maximum 
amount of sugar allowed, to the nearest hundredth of a gram?

tossupQ:
EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE Multiple Choice Which of the following is a depositional 
feature formed by a glacier? 
 
W) Arête (read as: ah-RATE) 
X) Horn 
Y) Cirque 
Z) Kame (read as: CAME)
bonusQ:
EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE Multiple Choice Iceland is very tectonically active; which 
of the following does NOT contribute to its interesting geologic and tectonic past and present? 
 
W) Location atop a divergent boundary 
X) Location adjacent to a subduction zone 
Y) Location atop a hot spot 
Z) Abundant transform faults
bonusA: X) LOCATION ADJACENT TO A SUBDUCTION ZONE

tossupQ:
PHYSICAL SCIENCE Multiple Choice The kinetic energy of an object is proportional to 
which of the following? 
 
W) Its velocity 
X) The square of its velocity 
Y) Its momentum 
Z) Its angular momentum
tossupA: X) THE SQUARE OF ITS VELOCITY

is the same before and after the reaction, what is the ratio of final pressure to initial pressure in 
the container?

lithium (read as: LI-thee-uhm) ion batteries capable of storing 10 megawatt hours of energy to

PHYSICAL SCIENCE Short Answer What is the term for the reactant used up first in a

bonusQ:
PHYSICAL SCIENCE Multiple Choice A spring lies flat on a frictionless table and oscillates 
with a mass attached to the end of it. Which of the following is NOT true regarding this system? 
 
W) Kinetic energy is greatest at the equilibrium position 
X) Potential energy is greatest at two different displacements 
Y) Potential energy is least at the equilibrium position 
Z) Increasing the mass of the attached object will increase the magnitude of the spring force
bonusA:
Z) INCREASING THE MASS OF THE ATTACHED OBJECT WILL INCREASE THE 
MAGNITUDE OF THE SPRING FORCE
